definition: open-minded
to open up (windows for air, ideas for discussion, transportation routes etc)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Consider the recent opening of the new, expanded Fairview Container Terminal at the Port of Prince Rupert.
sentences.chinese: 最近在鲁伯特王子岛港新开通了怡景集装箱转运站。

sentences.english: Do you require fund transfer services?
sentences.chinese: 您是否需要开通银证转帐服务？

sentences.english: You must sign the service agreement before we can go to work.
sentences.chinese: 服务开通前您得先签一下这个协议。

sentences.english: 1 minute to the airport light rail (up and running by 2011).
sentences.chinese: 离2011年底开通的机场轻铁仅1分钟路程。

sentences.english: But setting up a blog is just the first step.
sentences.chinese: 话虽如此，开通一个博客却仅仅是第一步。

sentences.english: Within the next three years it hopes to serve the pet jet-set in 25 North American cities.
sentences.chinese: 在未来三年里，北美25个城市有望开通宠物航班。

sentences.english: The Panama Canal opened almost one hundred years ago.
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河开通于近100年前。
1932年的今天，悉尼海港大桥开通。

sentences.english: you know, like, paying bills and setting up cable, and you know, talking to doctors.
sentences.chinese: 比如，支付账单，开通网络，还有去找医生看病。

sentences.english: And unlike those plans, Virgin lets you turn on service only when you want it.
sentences.chinese: 不同于其他方案，维珍让你仅当需要时才开通服务。

sentences.english: Last week China introduced the world's fastest scheduled service between Shanghai and Hangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 上周，中国速度最快的高铁沪杭高铁开通了。

sentences.english: With the opening of the bridge, the value of great natural environment in Dinghai becomes increasingly important.
sentences.chinese: 随着跨海大桥的开通，定海自然环境的价值日益凸显。

sentences.english: In addition, turn up, or off, the air conditioning or heater during the day.
sentences.chinese: 补充一下，在这些天里开通或者关闭，空调和加热器。

sentences.english: For example Nanchang to Shanghai high-speed railway line started generating profits in the first year of its operation after opening to public.
sentences.chinese: 比如，南昌到上海的高铁从开通第一年就开始盈利。

sentences.english: The second is diagnosing the closing fault of the train coupling cock.
sentences.chinese: 二是监测列车管折角塞门开通关闭状态。

sentences.english: The Confucius Institute Online has opened channels in 9 languages, with 100,000 registered users.
sentences.chinese: 网络孔子学院开通9个语种，注册用户达10万人。

definition: special-purpose phone line or communications link/hotline/special rail line (e.g. between airport and city)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to open to traffic (e.g. new bridge, rail line etc)/(of a locality) to have a transportation service/(Tw) to commute
to access (a network)/to insert (a plug) into (a socket)
to establish/to build
to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
to go nonstop to/through (as in "through train")/nonstop
high speed rail
railroad/railway/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
line/circuit/wire/road/railway track/bus route
(communications) channel/thoroughfare/passage
Tongdao Dong autonomous county in Huaihua 懷化|怀化[Huai2 hua4], Hunan
to put a new bus or railway station into operation
to connect/to communicate/to relate/(math.) connected
website
to access/to transfer passengers between two railway lines
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
